column4: because i just built another raid5 mdadm array....and im formatting it right now directly.  and i never made a partition table on it....and it works
was wondering if theres a downside to it
or something that will come and bite me in the ass down the road
so writing a partition table and THEN formating isnt going to make any difference then just straight direct formating without a table?
oh no this isnt going to be used for the OS, or be divided into partitions
yea
so i was just wondering if having no table will haunt me in the future......maybe cause problems
well forget that its a RAID
i just have it as one device right now.   or lets say this question pertains to my other single hdd
im just wondering if the partition table matters
after a few minutes with google, I've found a few offhand remarks about using the entire device, but nothing specific so far.
remarks about it being a bad idea, i mean.
bad idea?
using the entire device unpartitioned.

none of these newsgroup threads or anything mention specific bad things. I'd say you're probably fine, but if you're worried about it enough to ask here, why not just partition it with a single partition and be done with it?
will do that.  i was curious for the education of it....and because ive done it to other drives that i havent backed up yet

ah, okay. about the only thing i've found is a reference to one specific kind of drive that stored some kind of firmware after the partition table that would get nuked. i can't imagine that's common though.
oh, weird
HDDs store their firmware on the platter? wha???
it may not have been an hdd
ah
